result.execSummary:
The defendant Stephanie L Greske was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

ADDRESS INFO for Stephanie L Greske
Current: 465 Tower Road, Bancroft, WI 54921 United States  (Effective: 07-18-2017)
Prior: 4542 Martin Road, Wisconsin Rapids, WI 54494

Defendant Stephanie L Greske in court with attorney Erik John Mcfarland. Defendant Stephanie L Greske in custody. ADA Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Cases 14CM576, 15CM384, and 15CM474. 
  Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
14CM576 Ct 1: No contest
15CM384 Ct 2: No contest
15CM474 Ct 1: No contest

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty14CM576 ct 1, 15CM384 Ct 2, and 15CM474 ct 1.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
 The remainder counts are dismissed and read in.

ADA Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty McFarland concurs with joint agreement. 

BY THE COURT:***PROBATION***
14CM576 Ct 1: 
I/S Sentence: 40 days jail with 20 day in jail, second half maybe served on electronic monitor, if eligible according to local jail rules. Huber for employment, counseling and child care. - Stayed
18 months Probation:
Conditions: 
Not to be on the premises of Target or Walmart in Stevens Point/Plover.
Pay restitution $27.48 Walmart.
Any other counsel deemed appropriate by Agent.
Obtain and maintain full-time employment or schooling or a combination of both equaling full-time. 
Pay costs and surcharges, including DNA on all counts.

15CM384 Ct 2: 
I/S Sentence: 120 day jail, concurrent first 60 days  in jail last 60 days on Electronic Monitor, if eligible.
Same Huber. - Stayed
18 month Probation, concurrent with 14CM576
Same conditon
Pay restitution 98.54
Pay costs and surcharges.

15CM474 Ct 1:    
straight, 80 days jail, (55 days credit)
Pay court costs and surcharges.
60 days to pay or plan.
